alert.note: Alert for Coastal Franklin (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued December 21 at 2:47PM EST until December 22 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THURSDAY TO 7 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding expected. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Coastal Franklin County. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 7 PM Thursday to 7 AM EST Friday. For the High Rip Current Risk, until midnight EST tonight. * IMPACTS...Water levels will rise to 1.5 to 2.5 feet mean higher high water around the time of high tide. These water levels will result in minor flooding in Apalachicola near the boat ramp and also along Water Street. Minor overwash is possible at Alligator Point Road. Along St George Island, there is a high risk of rip currents. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Water levels will be highest around the time of high tide, which is around 130 am ET Friday morning. The threat for coastal flooding will end by daybreak Friday as winds shift offshore.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
